CommentBody: This is a Enterprise Auditor Ticket, Reassigning to Team lead queue

Ex_MetricsCollection does not work with EXO
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Requirements/Solutions/Exchange/Support.htm

Exchange > 8. Exchange Online > EX_Mailflow_Mailbox I believe has a similar report to what the customer was looking to get with User Traffic
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Solutions/Exchange/Online/Mailflow/EX_Mailflow_Mailbox.htm

I believe that job is already scheduled in the customers environment. Verify there are no issues with the 0. Collection > EX_Mailflow Job. History/Retention for this job is an analysis task, NOT via global option!
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Solutions/Exchange/Online/Mailflow/EX_Mailflow.htm

The customer is not set up to run Exchange Online.
The customer said they had migrated everything from Ex on-premise to Online
Under the Mailflow settings, I checked the Connection, and it was pointed to the wrong profile (an Active Directory profile), and the Host was targeting the Onpremise Exchange server.
 
Under the primary setting > Connection, I noticed the customer has a Modern Authentication for Exchange Online set up.

I advised the customer to switch the connection profile from Active Directory to ExModernAuth, switch from the On-Prem host to the Onmicrosoft.com host list, and rerun the job.

The job ran and quickly failed. 
When I checked the Connect Status under the Ex_Mailflow job, I discovered the 'Access Denied' under the Status.

I also checked the Azure Inventory job, and it was not set up.
The customer doesn't have access to the Azure Site, and the person with access is unavailable.
 
I explained to the customer with the Azure admin in the meeting to verify the permissions, and I also explained to him we need to set up the Azure Inventory job.

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/z-kb-articles-salesforce/page/kA0Qk0000001hVxKAI.html

So we can close this out.
